alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:13PM EST until January 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Blacksburg VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River At Altavista affecting Pittsylvania and Campbell Counties. For the Roanoke River...including Roanoke, Altavista, Brookneal, Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roanoke (Staunton) River at Altavista. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flood lowland pastures/farmlands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 19.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1015 AM EST.
